About Me

One or two things about me...

BIO

I am a graduate with a degree in BSc(Hons) Computer Security from the University of Wolverhampton. My experience is made up of a life surrounded by software/technology and my time at university. I hope to find and progress within a successful company.

I am fascinated by the evolution of technology in our daily lives; I have a keen interest in futuristic technology and like to keep myself up to date on political/technological world news. My areas of interest are: cyber security, ethical hacking, privacy, web development, programming, software development/engineering, latest hardware advancements, procuring computer hardware, the effects of social media and technology on society, changes to relevant government legislation.

Tech Enthusiast

Life time around technology

At an early age I was exposed to computing when my father and I built a computer together, since then I have been obsessed with all things tech from the latest PC hardware to games and gaming consoles


Since then my interests have matured and are now more in line with what I mentioned above:
Cyber Security, programming, ethical hacking and the effects of technology and social media on society. Although I still like to go back and enjoy my simpler interests by enjoying the odd video game here and there.

Telford College of Arts and Technology

Foundation computing student

College is where I studied Computing which is where I learnt:

• Programming (C#, HTML/CSS), Graduate level experience
• Systems Analysis Methodologies
• Use of Operating Systems (Linux/Windows Server/Windows),
• Procuring Hardware, this consisted of physically building computers and networks
• Database Management (Oracle Database 12c)
• Experience with Windows Server (Active Directory, Creating a Virtual and Physical Network)

University of Wolverhampton

Computer security bachelors degree student

Upon successfully passing my course at college I then moved onto university to study computer security where I learnt:

• SQL Database Design and Security
• SQL Oracle Data Modeller/Developer
• Networking Security (Ethical Hacking: Buffer Overflows, XSS, Packet Sniffing/Wireshark, SQL injections)
• Advanced Networking (Creating and monitoring networks)
• IT Security Management & Risk Analysis: experience in spotting risks and learning about industry standards such as ISO27001
• Use of Virtual Machines and Linux (Kali/Mint)
• Programming (HTML/CSS)

I have since completed my course and graduated from university with a first class degree with honours and I am now eagerly seeking out to get my career on track.
